reviews.text: If you are going with a group and want to enjoy full of time in Nepal and this is a best deal with good sport facilities, Good Rooms and services.
reviews.title: Best hotel & Resort in Kathmandu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a comfortable hotel. Spacious common areas and a nice garden restaurant for meals. The rooms overlooking the garden are nice, big and quite adequaltely furnished. Good air-con that was easy to control. It was very quiet here even though it was a busy hotel. Service in the bar was quick and happy hour with beers half-price (2 for 350 rupees) made them better value. It's not a cheap place to eat/ drink - very muchpriced at western levels; c. £30 for a one course dinner (burgers + chips) with wine for two. Service in the restaurant was slow and food was OK but not fantastic - a bit like pub grub. You can stay and eat much more chaeply in Kathmandu and I'm not sure that you would be any worse off. I think I'd return tot he Kathmandu guest house in Thamel instead - it has a better location and the prices are much more sensible for Nepal. If you're just looking for a nice place to stay over night and you're prepared to pay the price then this is fine, but if you want to use it as a base, even for a day or two, look elsewhere. From this hotel you need to get a taxi to visit any of the Kathmandu places of interest.
reviews.title: Too far from Thamel

reviews.text: Shangri la in Kathmandu should not be mistaken to be like Shangri Las in other parts of the world. Having said that, the rooms were nice enough and the service is OK - nothing spectacular. Much keep a note of a couple of things - internet is not free, room tariff depends on your bargaining power - travel agents manage to get it the cheapest (we paid 70$ eventually for a double room with breakfast) and its quite a walk to Thamel.
reviews.title: Good rooms, average service
Very welcoming...
reviews.text: So while its a decent place to stay, am sure there are better choices around.
A nice hotel with very friendly and accommodating staff
reviews.title: Great Hotel...Will definately stay again!

reviews.text: we stayed there for three night over new year.
reviews.title: average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hyatt regency when we were in Kathmandu last time. Hyatt regency is much better, but this hotel is much cheaper.
reviews.title: A little oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is just average. nothing wrong about this hotel. good sleep and average room etc.
reviews.title: Scalding Hot vs. Freezing Cold

reviews.text: If you are not staying so long in the hotel, this hotel is fine.
reviews.title: Good Good Everythings Good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While this may not be the most fantastic hotel in the world, it offers a tranquil haven after the chaos of Kathmandu. The staff are excellant, the rooms newly renovated, clean and reasonably westernized while trying to maintain a sense of Nepal. As the previous writer mentioned the water temperature in the shower is all over the place but this is Kathmandu and you can't expect everything to be perfect. I think this is a little overpriced for what it is but we were happy to pay it !
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in two different rooms at the Shangri La before and after Christmas surrounding a trekking trip we took near Mt. Everest. The first room we stayed in we later discovered was a 'non-renovated' room. The bathroom was extremely shabby, the shower was not nice, and there was no mini-fridge in the room. There is a business center, but Internet is not free you have to pay 250 NR per 30 minutes to use it. The restaurant is nice and there is a beautiful garden in the back of the hotel. It is also a quick 20-25 min walk to Darbar Square and the popular shopping/tourist area Thamel.
reviews.title: Make sure you get a renovated room

reviews.text: After the trip, we stayed at the Shangri La and discovered we were put in a newer room, that was renovated. The bathroom was great with a new hair dryer and newer bathroom and we had a mini fridge and TV.
reviews.title: Forget it if you need the internet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a nice hotel for the value and great location, but I'd just as soon have stayed at Radisson for a few bucks more. We had to stay here as it was part of our trekking package booked through Peregrine.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but nothing special

likes.disliked: — Intermittent hot and cold water in the shower.

reviews.text: How can $100 / nite hotel charge for the internet? $4 for a half hour. Ridiculous! And it cuts you off w/o any warning. The internet cafes are 30 rupees per hour, about 50 cents US. The air conditioning may work? You have to ask for a special tool to open the windows?
reviews.title: Sort out the plumbing

reviews.text: Nice garden though.
reviews.title: Friendly, comfortable,pleasant, safe: all for a reasonable price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a total of 3 nights at the Shangri-La and were very satisfied overall. The rooms and public areas are clean, and the garden, though much smaller than the Yak & Yeti, were well maintained. Breakfast was good, although the Nepalese options tended to be warm rather than hot. They do have a chef cooking eggs to order, and the staff were very efficient. The hotel is slightly away from the main shops and sights, but we did walk to Thamel in about 15-20 minutes - every trip takes a lot longer if you have to try and cross the road!!
reviews.title: peace and tranquility

reviews.text: We found a couple of restaurants within a 5 minute walk of the hotel, and as we prefer to try local rather than hotel meals, we ate twice in Alina;s, which offered very good momos and Nepalese dinners - also cold Everest beer.
reviews.title: An excellent value in a good location

reviews.text: Overall, we would probably stay at the Yak & Yeti if we go back, but there is not much to choose between them, and if you have booked the Shangri-La I am sure you will be well looked after.
reviews.title: Shangri-la is one of the best 4 Star Hotels in Kathmandu.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Shangri-La is a very nice stay in Kathmandu and just a 10-15 minute walk from the shopping and restaurants in Thamel. Don't skip the breakfast in the garden, it's absolutely beautiful in the morning sun.
reviews.title: Friendly, lovely hotel
Good place
reviews.text: The location of the Shangri-la is a major feature of this hotel as it is only 7 kilometers away from airport. Major administrative and political headquarters of the city are the neighbors of this hotel. Offering secured, luxurious and convenient accommodation, Shangri-la Hotel is supremely comfortable with excellent Room Facilities . The feature and facilities of the suites and rooms can compete with any of the international star hotels. Another major feature of Shangri-la Hotel is its property amenities and services. The hotel houses a beauty salon, spa and massage parlor, casino, health club, swimming pool and pool side bar and a children's play ground.
